dublin_core.dcvalue: This study aims to examine the relationship between perceived usefulness ease of use and enjoyment and attitude toward tablet computers and between social influence and use intentions for such devices as moderated by gender and age Results from a partial least squares analysis using a sample of 482 consumers in South Korea showed that perceived usefulness and enjoyment have a positive effect on attitude toward tablets while social influence and attitude toward tablet computers have a positive influence on intention to use tablets Furthermore gender and age moderated the relationship between perceived ease of use and attitude toward tablets
The moderating roles of gender and age in tablet computer adoption.
